image.altText: Two men in an office monitoring traffic on a large video board.

props.synopsis: Road authorities are urging Canberra drivers to avoid taking illegal and potentially dangerous shortcuts to avoid increased peak hour traffic due to the closure of the western side of London Circuit for light rail construction.

title.children: Traffic congestion prompts ACT authorities to take action on illegal driving

image.altText: exterior view of aged care facility

props.synopsis: Access to respite aged care in Canberra will become even tougher from June, when the ACT government will shut a 15-bed facility in Canberra's south.

title.children: Aged care respite facility to be shut despite growing demand

image.altText: A man wearing dark glasses walking outdoors with his head bowed.

props.synopsis: Dawson has lodged a special leave application in the High Court, as he seeks to secure a new trial, 40 years after he killed his wife.

title.children: Convicted killer Chris Dawson launches High Court appeal bid

image.altText: Judge Salvatore Vasta

props.synopsis: Federal Circuit Court Judge Salvatore Vasta has won his High Court bid for immunity from being sued by a man wrongly jailed during a family property dispute.

title.children: Federal Circuit Court Judge wins High Court bid for immunity

image.altText: Shorten stands speaking in the prime minister's courtyard.

props.synopsis: A speechwriter hired on a $600,000, two-year contract to write speeches for Services Australia and its minister Bill Shorten, has joined him at his new job at the University of Canberra.

title.children: Bill Shorten's $300k speechwriter follows him to University of Canberra

image.altText: an old man sits on a walking aid

props.synopsis: Former Christian Brother John Vincent Roberts, 83, has pleaded guilty to three counts of indecent assault which took place when he took his 15-year-old victim on drives to a forest.

title.children: Teenage boy 'empty inside' after being assaulted by teacher in 1980s

image.altText: Clive speaks at a podium in front of a blue National Press Club of Australia backdrop and gestures with his hands.

props.synopsis: Clive Palmer has lost his High Court bid to re-register the United Australia Party for this year's federal election, meaning the party's candidates will not be identified with the UAP on ballot papers for the House of Representatives and the Senate.

title.children: Clive Palmer loses bid to re-register United Australia Party

image.altText: outside view of federal court in australia

props.synopsis: A group of Canberra's social housing tenants are set to get their day in the Federal Court, with the way cleared for a class action against the ACT government over a plan to move them from their homes.

title.children: Class action by social housing tenants cleared to run

image.altText: Two women stand with an arm around one another, wearing traditional furs.

props.synopsis: The remains of two Moriori ancestors begin their journey home to New Zealand from the National Museum of Australia in Canberra as part a years-long repatriation process.

title.children: Moriori ancestors' remains 'coming home' after years in Canberra museum

image.altText: A boy goes to give an excited Albanese a high five in a classroom

props.synopsis: Parents will be guaranteed a minimum three days of subsidised child care regardless of how much they work or study, as parliament passes laws that take a step towards universal childcare.

title.children: Labor teams up with crossbench to guarantee three days of subsidised child care for all

image.altText: Bankstown Hospital nurses Ahmad Rashad Nadir, left, and Sarah Abu Lebdeh, right, leaning in to screen

props.synopsis: The NSW health minister says there is "no evidence" patients have been adversely affected after being treated by two Sydney nurses who spoke about threatening harm to Israeli patients, as police await an unedited version of their conversation with an Israeli content creator.

title.children: Nurses suspended from working in Australia after 'sickening' video

image.altText: Brielle holds her daughter as she looks off a balcony.

props.synopsis: Apartment living is a key pillar of government plans to ease the housing crisis by densifying well-connected parts of Australia's largest cities. But some have questioned the viability of the plans, saying the current stock of apartments was poorly suited for families.

title.children: Could a high-rise apartment replace the classic family home?

props.synopsis: Bali police are searching for a group of foreigners, who attacked security guards with wooden planks during a violent brawl outside Finns Beach Club.

title.children: Tourists and security clash in violent brawl outside popular Bali club

image.altText: A close of a young girl with a shovel of sand

props.synopsis: Authorities provide an update as Cyclone Zelia intensifies to category five system and the Bureau of Meteorology says it is bringing very destructive winds and heavy rain to West Australia's Pilbara.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Zelia now category 5, 'significant' impact expected in WA

image.altText: A man waving a stick with both ends on fire

props.synopsis: Scores of Taiwanese are being held against their will in sprawling cyber-fraud compounds in Myanmar, with family members being extorted for ransom their only hope of escape.

title.children: Family of Taiwanese scam-compound slaves say ransom only hope of escape

image.altText: Smoke rises above hills behind Rosebery

props.synopsis: Communities on Tasmania's west coast are bracing as bushfires bear down, with several communities on alert. Follow live.

title.children: Bushfires threatening communities on Tasmania's west coast

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Zeehan threat downgraded to Watch and Act
Embers over Zeehan, but crews ready

image.altText: Child's hand being held by an adult

props.synopsis: Protection from family violence is a postcode lottery and children should be allowed to apply for their own family violence orders, a parliamentary inquiry into the system has found.

title.children: Should kids get their own family violence orders? This report says yes

image.altText: Matthew Kuhnemann holds the ball aloft to acknowledge the crowd

props.synopsis: Tasmania expects Matthew Kuhnemann to play in their next Sheffield Shield match as Australia's latest spin sensation fights to save his bowling action.

title.children: Former spinner believes Kuhnemann's action is 'OK' after being cited

image.altText: Commonwealth Bank chief executive Matt Comyn looks at the camera in an office setting.

props.synopsis: Banks are prohibited from telegraphing rates moves in advance, but it doesn't take much reading between the lines to see that an RBA rate cut next week will be passed on in full.

title.children: CBA boss 'acutely aware' customers expect rate cuts to be passed on

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: ABC Adelaide Collinswood building. Photo taken Feb 13 2025.

props.synopsis: The ABC and South Australian government will investigate relocating the public broadcaster's Adelaide operations to a new central site, with plans to move in 2029.

title.children: ABC to move Adelaide operations out of landmark Collinswood building

image.altText: a woman holds a microphone out to a crowd of people

props.synopsis: After a successful event in 2024, this month's Souled Out music festival has been cancelled.

title.children: Major music festival cancels 2025 event a week before it starts

image.altText: Vicki Butler

props.synopsis: A doctor who helped in a homebirth where a mother died has been committed to stand trial charged with manslaughter.

title.children: Doctor committed to stand trial over mother's homebirth death

image.altText: A close up image of Kevin Rudd with his hand on his chin.

props.synopsis: Continuing to highlight Labor's past critique of Donald Trump carries political risk for the Coalition. Not least because it ignores what's really driving those encouraging Trump to apply tariffs to Australia.

title.children: Australia's US tariffs problem is more about the Coalition than Kevin Rudd

image.altText: The female humpback anglerfish was spotted during a shark research expedition.

props.synopsis: The footage was captured on a shark research trip off the Canary Islands.

title.children: Video captures 'black seadevil' swimming near ocean's surface for first time

image.altText: A researcher holds a pipette under a microscope.

props.synopsis: Australian researchers dependent on US funding are facing an uncertain future as the Trump administration attempts to slash funding and slap restrictions on medical and scientific research.

title.children: Trump funding cuts leave Australian researchers in limbo

image.altText: A woman walks across a parking lot.

props.synopsis: Police searching for missing Queensland mum Tayla Spies hope information from the public can help them narrow down a vast search area and ultimately find the 29-year-old.

title.children: New footage shows last known movements of missing mum

image.altText: An aboriginal woman with black hair looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Leonie Ebsworth was around 19 years old and enjoying a night at the Empress Hotel in Redfern, New South Wales, when a man approached her and said the impossible.

title.children: 'You're my sister': The words that untangled a stolen childhood

image.altText: Two hands holding cards place the cards amid a number of bunches of flowers on some grass.

props.synopsis: A woman who knew the victim of Alice Springs' latest alleged domestic violence homicide on Sunday says survivors are "petrified" and crying out for help.

title.children: Women 'petrified' amid Alice Springs DV crisis, survivor says

image.altText: A french fry is dipped in a small glass container with tomato sauce.

props.synopsis: Keeping tomato sauce in the fridge after opening is the best approach, experts say, even though the food safety risk is relatively low.

title.children: Pantry or fridge? Where to store tomato sauce and other condiments

image.altText: Cassius lies on his back with puppies sitting on his chest

props.synopsis: The brother of one of four people alleged to have murdered 15-year-old Cassius Turvey tells a court he saw one of the accused with weapons, just before the teenager was struck over the head with a metal pole.

title.children: One of Cassius Turvey's alleged murderers seen with weapons, court told

image.altText: A bell towel of an Orthodox church in the town of Oia on the island of Santorini, Greece

props.synopsis: Santorini, hit by an earthquake in late January, has since been shaken by a swarm of tremors. Most of its 16,000 residents have fled, and authorities have declared a state of emergency on nearby Amorgos as the quakes continue.

title.children: What's next for Greek tourism hotspot rattled by an 'earthquake swarm'

image.altText: A line of cars stationary on a country road.

props.synopsis: Emergency services are at the scene where a motorcycle and bus collided on the New England Highway about 40 kilometres from Tamworth.

title.children: Major NSW highway closed after motorcyclist dies in school bus crash

image.altText: A stolen rocket launcher is manipulated by a gloved hand.

props.synopsis: A short video, exclusively obtained by the ABC, purports to show someone in possession of stolen defence force rocket launchers for the first time in 10 years.

title.children: Fears over terror link as missing ADF rocket launchers offered in underworld trade

image.altText: A young woman with dyed blonde hair and bright pink eyeshadow sings into a microphone

props.synopsis: Love in a reality TV singing competition; South Korean family obligation; tender Belgium coming of age; RPG escapism — our picks from the 2025 Mardi Gras Film Festival.

title.children: Forget Emilia Pérez and check out this unhinged French musical instead
